intro: Ophiorrhiza oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mangrove, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhizophoraceae. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in coastal areas, particularly in mangrove ecosystems. The plant has opposite, oblong leaves that are usually smooth and glossy, and it produces small, white flowers followed by capsule fruits. It is adapted to saline and waterlogged soils, making it an important component of tropical coastal vegetation. Its root system helps stabilize sediments and provides habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
